Owlhawk:  SIR YES SIR!

Owlhawk flies out towards the Mechs.

--- airly2000 <airly2002@...> wrote:
> Rodimus Prime::
> 
> 
> The base's computer get a signal that an unknow bot
> was aproaching to 
> zone. Rodimus opened comlink with Owlhawk and said
> "Owlhawk, our 
> scanners reporter an unknow bot aroun the base, can
> you find out who 
> is it and what're his or her intentions? I need to
> know about as soon 
> as you can"
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > Owlhawk came out of the CR chamber with his wing
> fully
> > repaired.
> > 
> > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > After some hiking, the two metal warriors came
> up a
> > > rocky ridge, and a 
> > > grassy plain extended to the north. Suddenly,
> the
> > > Loremaster stopped.
> > > 
> > > Ragnar: What is it, Katya? Is there something
> wrong?
> > > 
> > > Katya: I am not certain... It think I saw
> something
> > > beyond that forest 
> > > to the west... Unless... (she switched to
> magnetic
> > > resonance) Yes! 
> > > There is something! A large metallic form about
> the
> > > size of a 
> > > dropship!
> > > 
> > > Ragnar let out a cry of victory. He jumped on
> place
> > > and felt 
> > > overjoyed.
> > > 
> > > Ragnar: Yes! Maybe we will beat this stravag
> planet!
> > > Let us go that 
> > > way!
> > > 
> > > As he started forward, Katya crossed her arms,
> not
> > > moving and cleared 
> > > her throat.
> > > 
> > > Katya: Are you not forgetting something, quiaff?
> > > 
> > > Ragnar: Neg, Katya Kerensky. If it is hostiles
> you
> > > fear, I do not 
> > > understand why. We are battlemechs after all and
> we
> > > will move at a 
> > > medium distance from each other. This way, we
> will
> > > be able to 
> > > retaliate together without fearing group shots
> > > against both of us. 
> > > Besides, I have yet to believe any hostiles are
> > > here.
> > > 
> > > Katya: I see your point, but let us be prudent.
> Take
> > > the lead.
> > > 
> > > And so they went, approaching the Maximal base
> and
> > > entering scanner 
> > > range.
